answers.answer: By RTA do you mean renal tubular acidosis?  I have definitely seen cases of 6th nerve palsy improve over time but I am a little concerned about the duration here. Usually things would start to improve in a 2-3 months.  I still am not clear as to exacly why you developed the bilateral 6th nerve palsy in the first place,  Not knowing all your details I would have to direct you to a neuro-ophthalmologist.  In general, if the problem is due to a systemic disease problem, it will often get better as the disease gets better (eg improved diabetes control, improved pseudotumor cerebri, improved intrracranial pressure, improved hypertension.)  In your case, I'm not sure what is actually going on.  I wish you well, see a neuro-ophthalmologist.
